name: Hotel San Francesco

reviews.text: My thinking on Rome hotels is that they're very much like hotels in London and NYC. Over-priced and small. If you keep this in mind, you won't be disappointed at Hotel San Francesco. Our room on the third floor was very small and dark because of the small, high windows. Our room faced the main street and there was no view except scaffolding across the street. There was some street noise, but we wore ear plugs so that wasn't a problem. The furniture looked worn with scratches here and there. The double bed was very firm, which we like. The bathroom was large and very clean, as was the room itself. Air conditioning worked beautifully. Overall the room was good for sleeping, but didn't have much ambience. That suited us fine since we were hardly ever in our room. Other pluses: the breakfast was excellent with a broad selection. There was sliced fruit, pastries, cereals, ham, cheese, eggs, toast, juice, coffee. It was the best of the five hotels we visited. The service was excellent during breakfast -- efficient and very courteous. Front desk service was outstanding and also efficient though not what I would call warm and friendly. Max specifically was very helpful. Here are some examples of the service he provided/arranged. One day the hair dryer didn't work and after breakfast I mentioned it to Max at the front desk. Back in the room and just 5 minutes later, a temporary dryer was delivered and then later the entire outfit was replaced while we were out of the room sighseeing. One morning I was sick and my husband asked Max if there was an orange that he could bring up to me rather than a glass of OJ from the breakfast bar. Max said he would take care of it. About 10 minutes later, a lovely tray was delivered with a full pot of tea, toast, and two oranges. What a nice surprise and at no charge. Pick-up from the airport was reliable. Though we had to wait in a long line to get through immigration, then another hour for bags, the hotel's arranged car service was still waiting for us two hours after we had landed. We never called once to say we were being delayed. If this had been NYC, we would have been SOL.
reviews.title: Fabulous Breakfast and Excellent Service

likes.liked: — The breakfast and location in non-touristy area

reviews.text: Overall, for a 3-star hotel, I think this hotel is very satisfactory. This was my second trip to Rome and the Hotel San Francesco was far superior and a much better value than the hotel I stayed at five years ago in the trendy Spanish Steps/Via Condotti area. Trastevere is really a cool, not so touristy area, across the Tiber River. The area has a lot of delightful shops and restaurants and we really enjoyed stay there. Though not close, we did walk to all the major tourist sites and took cabs back to the hotel.
reviews.title: San Francesco - Good Location but-

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Finally, don't forget to check out the roof-top bar. Very cool!
reviews.title: Nice hotel, easy location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a 2 week vacation in Italy, our first 4 nights were at the San Francesco Hotel in Rome.
reviews.title: Right next to Rome's most characteristic quarter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a nice hotel, located on the Trastevere area. The place is clean but the rooms are very small and a little overpriced.
reviews.title: Not quite living up to expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent one night here at the end of 8 days cycling from Coast to Coast, and overall thought it was a good option well placed for the historical centre and Trastavere. It is on the edge of the latter, and is well organised with reasonably smart accomodation. we had a helpful welcome, and a good dinner recommendation. The roof terrace is nice, although the drinks are a little pricey. The hotel is not on but is very close to the very busy Via Trastavere, and therefore inevitably there is a lot of traffic noise and will not suit those who dislike noise especially at night. We stayed elsewhere during the
reviews.title: Well placed for the historic centre

likes.disliked: — The noise from the main road nearby.

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: trip at hotels which were primarily geared to those who like an italian imprint on their food and surroundings - we felt that this hotel oriented itself much more strongly to meeting Northern European
and North American needs which will be a positive for some but wasn't
reviews.title: Great hotel and location

reviews.text: for us (all down to personal choice ). In summary, plusses definitely
reviews.title: Lovely hotel well worth a visit.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: outweigh the minusses but its useful to be aware of the latter.
reviews.title: Very nice!

likes.liked: — loved the rooftop bar in the evenings for a glass of wine

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: My family has stayed at San Fran for the past 2 years running, staff really helpful when directing you around Rome, the big dude at reception desk - could not do enough for us. Very clean, great Breafast but no restuarant or snacks available - plenty in the area though and with real Romans dining out. Area was cool, city centre within walking distance - happy days December the time to go no mass of tourists - stroll in the streets, bit of shopping, do as the romans do. have a great stay - great city!
I was very disappointed with this hotel,which from the write up seemed ideal.
reviews.title: Good breakfast-but--
lovely hotel
reviews.text: I arrived with my daughter about 10pm,after a delayed flight.The welcome was cool,and we were left to transport our luggage to our rooms.
We would have welcomed the offer of a snack,maybe we should have asked,maybe they should have offered.
reviews.title: The ideal location

reviews.text: Our room was well past its sell by date and cramped.The walls were paper thin, we could hear ordinary conversations in the next room.
reviews.title: Surprisingly Disappointed!
Perfect hotel near perfect location
reviews.text: We spent 5 nights in Hotel San Francesco between 1st and 6th of December with our 1-year-old baby (sorry about the inconveniences to our neighbours :-).

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: The service was excellent, the breakfast was really great. Everybody was nice and helpful.

reviews.title: A Nice Hotel-Great breakfast
reviews.text: Most tourist attractions were reachable on foot (depending on how much you like to walk) in a maximum of 30-40 minutes.
The room was small but clean, and it had a large bathroom.
reviews.title: Charming little hotel – great breakfast

reviews.text: This was one of the best hotels that we stayed at in our entire time in Italy. We were in Italy for 3 weeks and spent 5 days at this hotel. The service is great, the decor is fabulous, the staff is absolutely wonderful and accomodating. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Outstanding Breakfast
We would love to come back to this hotel!
reviews.text: We loved our stay. The staff makes you feel very welcome. The rooms are tidy, bathrooms are fine. We had a nice room at the backside of the hotel overlooking the garden of the monestry. We woke up with the birds singing and the sun shining!
The breakfast is great Fresh fruit, eggs, bread and all sorts of little typical Italian sweets.
reviews.title: OK hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although there is no service on the roofterrace yet (depending on the weather it will probably me late March or April), the weather was so nice that we brought some beers and enjoyed the beautiful views. It must me great to sit up there when the evenings are a bit warmer and the roofbar is open. It's definitely a plus when you are searching for a hotel in rome! After a day of walking relaxing in the sun, or a lovely after dinner drink.
reviews.title: Great option in wonderful part of town

reviews.text: O, and then we must give a tip of what we found to be the best restaurant in Trastevere: Hostaria Glass, Vicolo del Cinque, 58 (near the Chiesa Santa Maria): great dishes, good balance in price and quality, lovely wines, nice staff, beautiful degin interior!!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

likes.disliked: — No air con - open windows = mosquito bites

reviews.text: This is an OK hotel. The rooms are small and the walls are thin! The staff and the breakfast were both very good and the location is also good. However, I think I would stay somewhere different next time. The price was reasonable for Rome and if you sleep heavily you should have no problem.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

likes.disliked: — Location was a little tough when you were out all day and still had a long walk back to hotel

reviews.text: We had a 3 night stay in Rome from the 1st Feb to the 4th. The hotel is not central but everything worth seeing is only about 1/2 hour walk at most. The graffiti was a bit of a shocker around the hotel, and the surrounding areas, but you seemed to get used to it and felt perfectly safe in the small streets surrounding the hotel. There were loads of restaurants to choose from, without actually eating in central Rome, and the prices were very reasonable. The Breakfasts were great at the hotel, fruit, eggs, bread etc. The room was a little on the small size, but to be honest, for the price we paid it was absolutely fine. However, if you get an opportunity, ask for a room away from the front of the hotel as it got quite noisy. We were given maps on arrival, which was just as well as our taxi driver had absolutely no idea where the hotel was and took us on a mystery ride!! Lukily we had agreed a price beforehand. I would recommend that you get the bus from the airport to the termini station this only cost us about £10.00 each return! We then got a taxi to the hotel which cost about £10.00. I would definately use this hotel again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for the Price!
Great Experience
reviews.text: I checked into this hotel on 1/4/06 for a three night stay. My boyfriend had become terribly ill on the flight to Paris. The gentleman at the front desk was very helpful, and directed me to a pharmacy to get mediciation. He also helped translate the directions once I brought back the medicine. The breakfast was great, and they even allowed me to bring a tray up to the room for my sick boyfriend.
Everytime we had a question about locations and food recommendations, we were provided with thorough directions. They had great recommendations for pizza in Trastavere - Ivo...yum!
reviews.title: Excellent location, nice people

reviews.text: Our room was very comfortable and clean. My favorite part was the bathroom, with a big tub and a towel warmer! The bed was comfortable, and the ambient temperature was fine as well. I definitely felt that the service and amenities exceeded a 3 star rating.
reviews.title: Perfect location away from it all

reviews.text: My only complaint was that we could hear some outside noise in our room from what sounded like a train crossing. Also, they used a rather toxic smelling cleaning material in our room. Airing it out for a few minutes cleared up the smell, but it was unpleasant.
reviews.title: I don't get it...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did extensive research for our trip to Italy and hoped that our efforts would prove successful. This hotel was everything we had read and more. It is a delightful boutique hotel with modest but very clean rooms, large bathrooms, comfortable beds, beautiful rooftop terrace and excellent location. Try to get a room facing the courtyard. The view is lovely and peaceful. We could walk to delicious trattorias or hop on the bus or tram to all of our planned sightseeing excursions. Breakfast was more than substantial to start us off on our exciting days. We couldn't get over the wonderful flavor of the eggs and blood oranges! Special thanks to Max, "concierge extraordinaire". He helped us locate restaurants, best routes to travel and did everything he could to make our stay a very pleasant one.
reviews.title: Cannot say enough!

reviews.text: I chose the Hotel San Francesco for my parents' two-night stay in Rome in April, 2007. We were in Room 101. We specifically wanted a hotel in Trastevere, and this offered both comfort and convenience.
reviews.title: superior for Trastevere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was easy, and the staff quiet but friendly. The availability of an internet terminal for free in the lobby was useful, and the breakfast selection was large and delicious. The room was comfortable (though the view of a building covered in scaffolding completely uninteresting), and although the room itself was not especially spacious, it was adequate and the bathroom quite posh. There is a lot of street noise at night if you stay in a room on the front of the building (like room 101), so avoid this if you're a light sleeper.
reviews.title: The truth

reviews.text: The "seasonal" rooftop bar was not open, but fortunately there was still access to the roof patio, so we bought wine and hors d'oeuvres at a grocery store and made an aperitivo picnic up there both night (the view and the sunset were wonderful).
reviews.title: Lots to love, but....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only fear in writing this review is that the hotel will become so popular that i'll no longer be able to get a room.I've stayed here 4 times.I love Rome,have walked it end to end and would only stay in Trastevere.There aren't many hotels in Trastevere but this one is the best.It is part of a monastery and is attached to the church.My first morning at breakfast i looked out of the cloisters to see a a franciscan monk feeding the birds just like a postcard of St.Francis.You hear the church bells ring.You can get up in your slippers and walk round the corner for mass in a church which houses a masterpiece by Bernini.Across the (Sometimes busy as it is a rat run between 2 main roads although it itself is a small side road but never found it a problem)road is Paolo's Trattoria where they don't speak English(fantastic)and serve most excellent traditional Italian food at great prices.The rooftop terrace is open all year i have found but the BAR only opens in summer.It is wonderful and makes the hotel.The rooms are small as they are former monks cells which gives them historical charm as St.Francis stayed there.They are a little worn and as some people have said there is a funny smell which i think is actally the polish they use for the furniture and is not because they are dirty as they are spotless,especially the bathrooms.They do have a sort of rubber flooring but it is not an issue.You will not feel uncomfortable.I have looked at alternatives - possibly on the Aventine hill which you can see from the roof - which have better rooms but are a little further fromTrastevere.There are places to eat (particarily pizza)in this area which will make you want to come back to Rome.Ai Marni for one on Via Trastevere.Walking times are 30 mins max to St.Peter's and a lovely walk it is.About the same for the Forum/Colliseum/Pantheon etc.Spanish Steps are furthest away and that's fine as they have relative to the rest of Rome very little historical significance and are just a place for tourists to sit.Much better to sit in Piazza Santa Maria in Trastevere and watch the buskers with a Gellati.
reviews.title: Geat Area... Soulless Hotel...

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel San Francesco for 4 nights during his 15-day R&R from Iraq. We both enjoyed Hotel San Francesco and its location in Trastevere (although as another reviewer pointed out, our taxi driver from the train station had no idea where the hotel was located). When we return to Rome, we would definitely stay across the river again to enjoy the neighborhood feel and the great restaurants. The hotel had positives and negatives (as do all hotels). We appreciated having free internet access to check our email from time to time. The breakfast room and the morning buffet were great, and our server, Rosa, remembered after the first day that I liked American coffee with milk and brought it the moment we entered the dining room. Rosa also served our drinks in the rooftop bar, which was a lovely place for an afternoon cocktail after sightseeing. Our room was small, but perfectly fine and the bathroom spacious and sunny. The lobby is decorated in an eclectic style and is very nice for reading the newspaper or just meeting other guests. The desk staff was very nice, but not overly helpful. Those who spoke English did a great job. Would definitely return to the Hotel San Francesco!
reviews.title: A Nice Hotel in Trastevere
San Francesco is both stylish and friendly
reviews.text: Always found a warm reception and pleasant smiling staff at San Francesco in the fascinating Trastevere district, where local restaurants, shops and hairdressers were also eager to provide excellent service. Made us so welcome during a long weekend in Rome. Twin room was on the small side but the large bathroom made up for this. everyone was so kind and helpful at the hotel. There is a real attention to detail in San Francesco, from the regular bedroom checks and towel changes to the well stocked and fresh breakfast buffet each day. The hotel is small but quite stylish and spotlessly clean, and, if April weather had been drier, we would have been happy to relax on the peaceful roof terrace. A lucky find! Really enjoyed the visit and will certainly come again next time we are in Rome.

If you're looking for a great free breakfast, stay here! The spread is amazing and the breakfast room is quite nice. The rooftop view is also great and the rooftop bar is probably cool, but it was closed during April when we stayed there. The room was a little dark and dreary, not much to speak of. The bathroom was small but clean. The shower was really a glass phone booth. But it had windows that opened out onto the street and gave a nice breeze. The service was very good and the area was not bad.
reviews.title: Cute hotel

reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from a 5 night stay at the San Francesco. I have no complaints, especially considering the very reasonable 165 EUR rate. Yes, the rooms are small, but the bathrooms are actually quite roomy. It is a boutique hotel. Generally that means smaller rooms. The hotel staff were all helpful and polite. The included breakfast was a nice way to fuel up for a day of walking. And you will be walking in Rome (regardless of where you stay).
reviews.title: Great Hotel. Great Location.

reviews.text: The hotel is about 10-15 minutes from the heart of Rome and about 25-30 from the Vatican. We walked everywhere and never felt the need to take a cab (except for one afternoon during a particularly strong downpour). I would stay in Trastevere over any other area of Rome. It is still very close to most of the main sites and it is such a more peaceful environment. Tons of restaurants and bars. Narrow, winding streets with nearly non-existent car traffic.
reviews.title: Not as good as expected

description: Hotel San Francesco is a real boutique hotel uniquely and advantageously located in the fashionable downtown neighborhood of Trastevere. A terrific roof bar with 360 degree panoramic view over Rome, is available to guests for enchanting evening cocktail.
